completed.result: A new version (0.2.0) using Python and the PySide Qt bindings has been released. It is roughly feature equivalent to the last Java version.
completed.description: The last Java version (0.1.4) had a functional start screen, a preliminary editor showing a map and a game center dialog allowing to choose a scenario. All these features will very likely be part of the final game design because they are so essential. In order to release a Python version a Python version with roughly the same features should be created. This will attract attention to the project and allows us to test the Python release pathways. Do not include more features for now but rather break them down to individual tasks later.
completed.title: Release: Bring Python version of the game roughly to the state of the last Java version

progress.description: Rules: The game specification is an extensive document describing all the various details of the game and how they interact. It needs public discussion and constant revising. But first it should be in a draft like state at least mentioning all the important parts as detailed as possible. In the next 2-3 months finish it and then publish it for public discussion.
progress.title: Finish first comprehensive version of game specification

progress.description: This is not a task but a milestone. It will be marked completed automatically if the following state is reached: workable first version of editor, selection of a scenario and simple play (making turns, inspecting various screens, doing some stuff with it).
progress.title: Milestone: 0.3

progress.description: The map is a central piece of the UI. Many layers (terrain, ressources, rivers, grid, borders, units, cities) need to be painted. Also the nations must be made customizable (color, name, ...).
